question: Which of the following statements are true about <katex>$[CoF_{6}]^{3-}$</katex> ion?
I. The complex has octahedral geometry.
II. Coordination number of Co is 3 and oxidation state is + 6.
III. The complex is <katex>$sp^{3}d^{2}$</katex> hybridised.
IV. It is a high spin complex. [cite: 191-195]
explanation: <katex>$[CoF_{6}]^{3-}$</katex> contains <katex>$Co^{3+}$</katex> with weak field <katex>$F^-$</katex> ligands. It is octahedral (Coordination number 6), outer orbital (<katex>$sp^3d^2$</katex>), and high spin. Statement II is incorrect. [cite: 198, 199]
